intro: Stachytarpheta scaberrima, commonly known as the roughleaf ironweed, is a tropical flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, often rough-textured leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. Stachytarpheta scaberrima is also valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
